content.description:
IMO, not close to the five star Marty considers it.  It gets some points for length, but some of the rock is pretty poor (though it will probably clean up w/ traffic), the line is a little vague at one point and the hard part is relatively run of the mill and brief (though rope drag may make it seem longer.)  The slab ending adds some quality.

Between the 6th and 7th bolt careful routefinding may be required.

Two 100' raps to descend.
content.protection: 19 bolts.  Some long slings are advised.
content.location: A little bit left of the left end of the Eldorado roof.  Shares the first bolt with the much superior Probation Violation.

climbs.name: Probation Violation
climbs.fa: Fred Berman, Marty Lewis, 4/1993, top down

content.description: Really cool long pitch up a stunning face.  Balancy and precise, but steep enough to make you work for it. Beautiful position over a bend in the Owen's River.
content.protection:
14 bolts, 2 anchor bolts.

The Marty Lewis guidebook, 11th edition Â lists this route as 37.5 meter lower off. I managed to lower off with a 70 meter rope, but my buddy had to let the end slip through the Grigri! Some brands cut their ropes longer than 70 meters -- mine is Mammut. Anyways, tie a knot!

If you can't reach the ground, you can lower to the anchors of Enraged Pixie. It might be hard to get your remaining quickdraws on lower out, however.
content.location: Just left of the left side of the Eldorado Roof.  About 10 meters right of the ladder that bypasses the ledge with Dilithium Crystal.  Starts up a shallow corner.  Shares the first bolt with Wiggly.
